    • Method Detail

      • setCallbackUri

        public IdSiteUrlBuilder setCallbackUri(String callbackUri)
        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Sets the location where the user will be sent when returning from the ID Site. This property is mandatory and must be set. See the application.newIdSiteCallbackHandler documentation for information on how to process requests to your callbackUri.

        For security reasons, this location must be registered in your ID Site configuration in the Stormpath Admin Console.

        Specified by:
        setCallbackUri in interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Parameters:
        callbackUri - the final destination where to get the browser redirected.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setState

        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Sets application-specific state that should be retained and made available to your callbackUri when the user returns from the ID Site.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setPath

        public IdSiteUrlBuilder setPath(String path)
        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Sets the initial path in the ID Site where the user should be sent. If unspecified, this defaults to /, implying that the ID Site's landing/home page is the desired location.
        Example

        Most Stormpath customers allow their ID Site's default landing page / to reflect a traditional 'Login or Signup' page for convenience. However, if you know that an end-user is attempting to register, and your ID Site's user registration form is located at /register, you might want to call setPath(&quot;/&quot;) to send the user directly to that view instead.

        Specified by:
        setPath in interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Parameters:
        path - the initial path in the ID Site where the user should be sent.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setOrganizationNameKey

        public IdSiteUrlBuilder setOrganizationNameKey(String organizationNameKey)
        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Ensures the ID Site is customized for the Organization with the specified organizationNameKey. This is useful for multi-tenant or white label scenarios where you know the user belongs to a specific Organization.
        Specified by:
        setOrganizationNameKey in interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Parameters:
        organizationNameKey - unique identifier of the Organization to use when customizing ID Site.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setUseSubdomain

        public IdSiteUrlBuilder setUseSubdomain(boolean useSubdomain)
        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Ensures that the user will visit ID Site using a subdomain equal to the organizationNameKey instead of the standard base domain.

        Example

        Assume your ID Site is located at the domain id.myapp.com. If you specify an organizationNameKey of greatcustomer and set useSubdomain to true, the user will be sent to https://greatcustomer.id.myapp.com instead, providing for a more customized white-labeled URL experience.

        Specified by:
        setUseSubdomain in interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Parameters:
        useSubdomain - true to ensure that the user will visit ID Site using a subdomain equal to the organizationNameKey, false to ensure that the standard ID Site domain will be used.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setShowOrganizationField

        public IdSiteUrlBuilder setShowOrganizationField(boolean showOrganizationField)
        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Ensures that the ID Site will show the organizationNameKey field to the end-user in the ID Site user interface.

        Setting this to true allows the user to see the field and potentially change the value. This might be useful if users can have accounts in different organizations - it would allow the user to specify which organization they want to login to as desired.

        Specified by:
        setShowOrganizationField in interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Parameters:
        showOrganizationField - true the ID Site will show the organizationNameKey field to end-user in the ID Site user interface, false otherwise.

      • setSpToken

        public IdSiteUrlBuilder setSpToken(String spToken)
        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Sets the sp_token property used by the IdSite to complete an account password reset workflow. The sp_token must correspond to an actual password reset token issued to one of the accounts of this application. If sp_token property is present and valid, the IdSite will be redirected to the IdSite URL (included the configured path, see IdSiteUrlBuilder.setPath(String), with the sp_token embedded in the signed JWT.

        Example

        Assume your ID Site is located at the domain id.myapp.com. If you specify a spToken of aSpToken and set path to #reset, the user will be sent to https://id.myapp.com/#reset?jwt=signedJwt, with the provided aSpToken value embedded in the signedJwt to complete the reset password process in your IdSite.

        Specified by:
        setSpToken in interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Parameters:
        spToken - a unique token used to reset a password.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • addProperty

        public IdSiteUrlBuilder addProperty(String name,
                                    Object value)
        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Convenience method to set any key value. This is important to decouple the server releases from the library releases, when a new property is supported in the initial IdSite call, and there is no setter to add such property during the initial request, this method can be used to add it.

        Example

        Assume the initial call for IdSite now supports a new property called exp (expire), since at the moment there is no such method to set the new property, you can use this new convenience method to the key-value pair to the request.

        addProperty("exp", new Date()), cal

        Notes:

        1) Properties like "iat", "iss", and "iat" will be overriden when the IdSiteUrl is being built, to avoid conflicts when the url is being consumed by Stormpath. 2) Prefer the setter methods over this one (when possible), since there is type safe guarantee via the setters.

        Specified by:
        addProperty in interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - of the new property.
        value - of the new property.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • forLogout

        public IdSiteUrlBuilder forLogout()
        Description copied from interface: IdSiteUrlBuilder
        A user that has an open session and wants to logout from it will invoke this method when constructing the callbackUri.

        To execute this operation the application will create a signed request to the internal logout endpoint in Stormpath (i.e. /sso/logout). If successfully executed, the user will be redirected to the callbackUri indicating that the account has been properly logged out.

        When users logs out, their session with the ID Site is no longer valid for every application pertaining to this domain. They will be required to log in again when trying to access any of those applications.

        Note that once this method is invoked, there is no way to modify it (i.e. undo) to make it point to the regular SSO endpoint. To achieve that, a new IdSiteUrlBuilder will need to be constructed.

        Specified by:
        forLogout in interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getBaseUrl

        protected String getBaseUrl(String href)
        Fix for https://github.com/stormpath/stormpath-sdk-java/issues/184. Base URL for IDSite is constructed from the applicationHref received in the constructor.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4.2
